conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to use the given information about the electromagnetic launch system and the equations of motion. The key is to find the current I of the constant current source using the given data.

Identify the given values: Takeoff speed v1 = 80 m/s, Time t1 = 1.5 s, Number of turns n = 100, Circumference of each turn l = 1 m, Mass of the aircraft M = 10 kg, Mass of the mover and coil m = 5 kg, Resistance R0 = 9.5 Ω, Magnetic flux density B = 0.1 T.
Calculate the magnetic force F on the mover: F = B × I × n × l, F = 0.1 × I × 100 × 1.
Calculate the acceleration of the mover and coil: a = (v1 - v) / t1, a = (80 - 0) / 1.5 = 80 / 1.5 = 160 / 3 m/s².
Use the equation of motion for the mover: m × a = F, 5 × (160 / 3) = 0.1 × I × 100.
Calculate the total resistance R: R = R0 + Rcoil, R = 9.5 + (5 × 160 / 3), R = 9.5 + 800 / 3, R = 9.5 + 266.67, R = 276.17 Ω.
Use Ohm's law to find the current I: I = V / R, V = I × R, V = (40 / 3) × 276.17, V = 3928.83 V.
Calculate the total power P: P = V × I, P = 3928.83 × (40 / 3), P = 5314.59 W.
Calculate the power loss in the resistor: Ploss = P × (R0 / R), Ploss = 5314.59 × (9.5 / 276.17), Ploss = 188.8 W.
Calculate the power available for the mover: Pavailable = P - Ploss, Pavailable = 5314.59 - 188.8, Pavailable = 5125.79 W.
Use the power available for the mover to find the current I: I = Pavailable / (m × a), I = 5125.79 / (5 × (160 / 3)), I = 5125.79 / 800, I = 6.43 A.
